data.title: Why St. Paul's
data.meta_description: Why St. Paul's - St. Paul's Episcopal Day School is an Age 2- 8th grade independent school in Kansas City, MO that develops confident learners and engaged citizens.
data.text:
Daily chapel lessons center students and prepare them for the day ahead, and this morning ritual makes the St. Paul's experience unique. While students sing, pray, and hear bible stories, there is also equal emphasis on life skills presentations, community speakers, and exploration of different faiths around the world. St. Paul's strives to instill a spiritual spark in our students, and this daily tradition allows space for student curiosity and self-reflection.

Learn more about the chapel program.

According to recent research, 85% of the jobs that will exist in 2030 haven't been invented yet. At St. Paul's, we offer dynamic curriculum to develop future-proof skills like communication, problem-solving, creativity, and collaboration.

St. Paul's classrooms and common spaces are newly renovated and feature flexible learning spaces, expanded science lab, a makerspace, galleries to display student work, and much more. This building transformation has created state-of-the-art spaces to enable hands-on learning across all grade levels.

Our students grow to be innovative problem-solvers who are prepared for life and work in the ever-changing 21st century. Click here to learn more about our academics across the school.

The St. Paul's community fosters the next generation of leaders who are kind, resilient, and innovative. With a focus on stewardship, community development, and social justice, St. Paul's students learn not just how to better themselves but how to better the world around them. Students participate in community initiatives, present to their peers on modern-day challenges, and contribute hundreds of service hours to local non-profit organizations.

Learn more about Service Learning at St. Paul's.

One of the benefits of a K-8 school is that middle school students are empowered to be role models for their younger peers. Our Buddy Program sets up authentic leadership roles and compels older students to care for others in their school community. During this critical time of adolescent development, middle school students learn to be empathetic, responsible, and selfless.

Ultimately, throughout a student's time at St. Paul's they are part of strong community of former and future teachers who are invested in their individual success.

Learn more about the Buddy Program at St. Paul's.
